thread.title: Newcastle United asked to pay £250,000 towards Richard Scudamore's leaving bonus - but will they agree?

author: Mark Douglas
title: Newcastle United asked to pay £250,000 towards Richard Scudamore's leaving bonus - but will they agree?
text:
Lee Charnley (left) and Richard Scudamore (right) (Image: PA/Getty) Get Newcastle United FC updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Newcastle United have been asked to pay £250,000 towards a £5million bonus for departing Premier League executive chairman Richard Scudamore.
Chelsea chairman Bruce Buck proposed the farewell gift in recognition of Scudamore delivering huge TV windfalls and the league’s progression over his 19 year tenure. The UK television rights were valued at around £670m when he joined, and the last deal was worth £5.14bn.
United are one of 20 clubs asked to provide £250,000 towards the golden handshake deal - although it was reported on Tuesday evening that the Premier League meeting broke up without an agreement on it. Newcastle may be one of the clubs reported to be uneasy with the idea, even if it is expected to pass. Read More VAR, Brexit and a new chief exec: Key Premier League issues which Newcastle will debate this week
United are represented at the meeting by Managing Director Lee Charnley.
Fans responded quickly by pointing out difficulties in Newcastle signing players due to funds and contrasting it with giving £250,000 to Scudamore. Others suggested the money would be better provided to grassroots football or charity - especially considering Scudamore’s annual salary is reported to be £250,000.
Meanwhile the Premier League confirmed Susanna Dinnage will replace Scudamore. Read More Dubravka's new coach and a key Premier League meeting: 6 things for Newcastle fans to look out for
Dinnage works for the Discovery channel, where she was global president of the Animal Planet channel.
“I am excited at the prospect of taking on this fantastic role. The Premier League means so much to so many people,” said Dinnage.
“It represents the pinnacle of professional sport and the opportunity to lead such a dynamic and inspirational organisation is a great privilege.
“With the support of clubs and the team, I look forward to extending the success of the league for many years to come.” poll loading Should Richard Scudamore get a £5million leaving bonus? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
